body:
Comment 6: 
requiring sse2 for 386 version of go is still an annoying thing that got
reported many times on the issue tracker.

unless we can figure out a way to do better (for example, do a smart
"go install -a -v std" at install time), probably we should just distribute
GO386=387 386 binary distributions and label them as legacy and not
suitable for benchmarking.

@adg, dave, what do you think?
